PRODUCTION NOTES:
The setting as designed by Bob Mellencamp, consisted of a
large cyclorama, of which an arc of twenty feet was used.
The Inn of the Three Pigeons was set to camera right, at a
slight angle to the center area of the eye; a ground row
ran across the back with a profile tree some four feet in
front of it. Another house of the village was set at a
matching angle to the Inn at camera left.
The costumes, as designed by Emmy Mellencamp, were a
compromise between the traditional children’s story-book
illustrations and authentic Flemish costumes of the Nine¬
teenth Century. Full costume notes for the stage production,
which will be of assistance to any one designing costumes
for a television version, are to be found in the printed
libretto of the full musical setting published by the Willis
Music Company.
